intro: Diteilis collinsii, commonly known as Collins' diteilis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Diteilis collinsii is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions.
